content:
Bodyweight exercises are a fantastic way to improve strength and flexibility without needing any equipment. Here are some exercises you can do on Wednesdays and Fridays:

**Wednesday ( Upper Body and Core):**

1. **Push-ups:** 3 sets of 10-12 reps
2. **Tricep dips (using a chair or bench):** 3 sets of 10-12 reps
3. **Inverted rows (using a door or ledge):** 3 sets of 10-12 reps
4. **Plank:** 3 sets of 30-60 seconds
5. **Bicycle crunches:** 3 sets of 10-12 reps
6. **Russian twists (sitting on the floor):** 3 sets of 10-12 reps

**Friday (Lower Body and Core):**

1. **Squats:** 3 sets of 10-12 reps
2. **Calf raises:** 3 sets of 15-20 reps
3. **Lunges:** 3 sets of 10-12 reps (per leg)
4. **Glute bridges:** 3 sets of 10-12 reps
5. **Wall sits:** 3 sets of 30-60 seconds
6. **Leg raises (lying on your back):** 3 sets of 10-12 reps

**Additional Tips:**

* Start with lower reps and sets and gradually increase as you build strength and endurance.
* Focus on proper form and technique over the number of reps or sets.
* If you're new to bodyweight exercises, consider starting with modified versions (e.g., knee push-ups instead of traditional push-ups).
* Rest for 30-60 seconds between sets, and 60-90 seconds between exercises.
* Engage your core muscles throughout each exercise to maintain good posture and stability.

Remember to warm up before starting your strength training routine with 5-10 minutes of light cardio (e.g., jogging in place, jumping jacks) and stretching. Cool down afterwards with some static stretches to help your muscles recover.

Have fun and don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions or need further guidance!
